image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses in front of the ocean

props.synopsis: Geraldton man Matthew Watson had a bad feeling when his friend didn't return to the boat during a spearfishing trip near Coral Bay on Monday. Then, he spotted him bleeding in the water.

title.children: 'I've been hit': Man describes pulling mate bitten by shark from waters off remote WA coast

image.altText: A man wearing a broad-brimmed hat stands in the outback on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Ancient Pilbara land and sea country will be revitalised after 12 new Indigenous Protected Areas were announced across Australia today.

title.children: New Pilbara protected areas 'key' to reversing negative impacts on Indigenous cultural heritage

image.altText: Alex de Minaur gestures with his hand after winning a match at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Australian hopeful Alex de Minaur has pulled out of Wimbledon with a hip injury, just hours before he was due to play Novak Djokovic in his first quarter-final at the All England Club.

title.children: Alex de Minaur denied Wimbledon showdown with Novak Djokovic by 'freak injury'

image.altText: WA CWA 100 years

props.synopsis: Western Australia's CWA branches have welcomed men into their ranks after 100 years, with members voting almost unanimously to grant men membership rights.

title.children: It's taken 100 years, but these women have voted to allow men into the Country Women's Association

image.altText: Jaymie Graham, Dean Cox and Ashley Hansen must be considered

props.synopsis: The West Coast Eagles are searching for a new coach after reaching the inevitable decision to show Adam Simpson the door, and they face a much tougher call picking his successor.

title.children: The men most likely: Who can propel the West Coast Eagles up the AFL ladder?

image.altText: A row of guns lined up in a collector's home.

props.synopsis: Farmers and recreational shooters say they've been labelled as "bad people" following recent changes to WA's firearms legislation, which will come into effect in March 2025.

title.children: Gun owners feel victimised by new WA firearms laws, touted as 'toughest' in the country

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission has revealed Australia's use of cocaine, methylamphetamine and nicotine is on the up, but cannabis remains the illicit drug of choice.

title.children: Here's what a new illicit drug report is revealing about Australian's drug habits

image.altText: A large fire on the roof of a factory, shown from the air.

props.synopsis: A factory fire sparked by a chemical explosion has been brought under control, but authorities say they expect it to burn for days.

title.children: 'Fireball' explosions and flying debris seen at site of Melbourne factory fire

image.altText: A police tent and forensic officer

props.synopsis: The wife and two daughters of a BBC commentator have been killed at a property near London as police search for a man armed with a crossbow.

title.children: Family of BBC commentator killed in UK home as police search for crossbow attacker

image.altText: Snakes lie on top of each other in a plastic bag which sits on a metal table

props.synopsis: Chinese officials stopped the man and found the reptiles — including milk snakes and corn snakes — in bags inside his pockets.

title.children: Man caught trying to smuggle more than 100 live snakes inside his trousers

image.altText: Two men and a woman standing and talking together.

props.synopsis: A new space designed to accommodate at-risk young people who had been roaming the streets of Broome at night is reducing pressure on police and improving outcomes for youths, according to organisers.

title.children: Safe overnight space for youths in Broome lets police 'get on with' jobs, minister says

image.altText: An eight-year-old girl with dark hair and wearing a pink cap sits on the knee of a person whose image is blurred.

props.synopsis: The court heard the eight-year-old was left the care of three members of a religious congregation of which the parents were also members.

title.children: Elizabeth Struhs spent last hours on a mattress on the floor as parents slept, court hears

image.altText: Three West Coast Eagles player, Liam Duggan, Reuben Ginbey and Thomas Cole, looking dejected as they walk off a field

props.synopsis: The Eagles were kings of the AFL in 2018 but have sunk to the bottom of the ladder.

title.children: How the West Coast Eagles went from AFL premiers to the wooden spoon

image.altText: A man in a pink shirts walks in front of blue and white boats tilted in all directions.

props.synopsis: Hurricane Beryl tears across the Atlantic Ocean, leaving at least 11 people dead in the Caribbean and three in the US state of Texas.

title.children: Hurricane Beryl leaves trail of destruction across Caribbean

image.altText: boxes of lemons and apples fill the frame of this photo

props.synopsis: Families and neighbours shopping through informal co-ops are saving hundreds, but the business model could help apply major competitive pressure to the major supermarkets.

title.children: There is a cheaper alternative to supermarkets, but most people don't know it exists

image.altText: The pope speaks into a silver-coloured microphone.

props.synopsis: The document will inform bishops at their October summit, where the role of women in the Church is on the agenda.

title.children: A Vatican document says women need 'fuller recognition' in the Catholic Church — but not as deacons

image.altText: Mikayla Hinkley stands with a cricket bat propped on her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Cricket hasn't just provided Mikayla Hinkley with a sporting career, it's also allowed her to connect with her Indigenous heritage and become a role model for aspiring athletes.

title.children: This Perth Scorchers player is breaking down barriers stopping young Indigenous people playing cricket

image.altText: Anna Meares speaks to the media

props.synopsis: Australian Olympic Team team chef de mission Anna Meares says she has faith in WADA to stamp out doping in sport after an independent investigation clears the body of any wrongdoing in the Chinese swimming controversy.

title.children: Meares backs WADA after body cleared of wrongdoing in Chinese swimming controversy

image.altText: A close up of Joe Biden speaking passionately and pointing with his right hand

props.synopsis: Joe Biden has given his highest-profile policy speech since his halting debate performance sparked speculation about his fitness for office. Here are the key moments from his NATO address.

title.children: Ukraine will stop Putin, Biden tells NATO in forceful speech

image.altText: Kirsha Kaechele and her fake Picasso.

props.synopsis: The 'Picasso' artworks hanging in a toilet at Tasmania's Mona gallery are revealed to be fakes, with the artist responsible saying during the three-year-long ruse she "fantasised there would be a scandal".

title.children: Artist admits to faking Picassos to 'match curtains' of gallery's lounge

image.altText: A grain ship at dock, with cranes in the background.

props.synopsis: More than 20,000 tonnes of wheat grain from a farming family in Gnowangerup is loaded onto a bulk carrier through the port of Albany, bound for the Indonesian port of Surabaya.

title.children: Grain handler CBH to expect more competition as family farm ditches bulk handler to export own wheat

image.altText: Mountain rescue stand on snowy peak with body on stretcher

props.synopsis: A climber discovered the body of a man buried in an avalanche in the Huascaran peak 22 years ago while he was making his own ascent.

title.children: Climber finds body of man buried in Peru avalanche 22 years ago

image.altText: Two close up images side by side of dingo and pet dog.

props.synopsis: A state government department confirms it is prepared to kill individual dingoes if necessary after several reported attacks on pets around Broome, but a carer for the native species says any culling would be "an absolute disaster".

title.children: Dingoes 'may be destroyed' if they pose a public safety risk in popular WA tourist town

image.altText: a group of about 15 police officers standing together in the cbd

props.synopsis: The NT police minister confirmed a decision on whether to extend the Alice Springs curfew will be made on Thursday morning, after the lock-out restrictions expire.

title.children: Violent brawl breaks out in Alice Springs ahead of curfew decision

image.altText: Lia and Bella

props.synopsis: This service allows commuters to report anti-social behaviour and sexual assault on public transport. But does it make women feel safer?

title.children: 'No-one was going to help me': Lia was on a tram when a man's behaviour left her feeling 'incredibly vulnerable'

image.altText: A blue coloured T logo with an orange oval mounted on a fake grass wall

props.synopsis: The telecommunications company faces an ACMA directive to correct an error which led to more than 140,000 customer records being made public, despite those customers paying for their information to remain unlisted.

title.children: ACMA issues directive to Telstra after massive privacy breach of unlisted numbers

image.altText: In a sequence of images, a young Indigenous teen is held down and struck with a baton by police.

props.synopsis: 7.30 has obtained footage showing police beating an Indigenous youth repeatedly with a baton in a watch house, sparking allegations of excessive use of force.

title.children: 'Abhorrent and distressing': Multiple police beat teenager locked in watch house

image.altText: A woman works at a desk with three screens.

props.synopsis: Australians are now much less likely to leave seek new employment, with job mobility falling for the first time in three years, according to the latest ABS figures.

title.children: Australians are struggling more to find jobs over 'too many applicants'

image.altText: A man with his head bandaged and a pained expression sits on a hospital floor next to a young boy

props.synopsis: Palestinian officials say an Israeli air strike in southern Gaza has killed dozens of people while advancing tanks in Gaza City forced residents to flee under fire as Israel stepped up an offensive that Hamas warned could jeopardise ceasefire talks.

title.children: 'Gaza City is being wiped out': Residents flee under fire as Israeli tanks advance in renewed campaign

image.altText: Lamine Yamal slides on his knees as he celebrates a goal for Spain against France at Euro 2024.

props.synopsis: Teenager Lamine Yamal helps Spain come from behind to defeat France 2-1, with the three-time champions now waiting to play either England or the Netherlands in the tournament decider.

title.children: Spain beats France to reach Euro 2024 final as 16yo creates football history

image.altText: Naarah poses sidewards to camera, smiling, with her hands up together wearing gloves in London

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Actor Naarah answers all the money questions we don't like to talk about as we seek to demystify personal finance and normalise conversations about how we think about money, what we earn and how we spend it.

title.children: 'I've been saving at least $2 a week since I was little': The money habits that allowed Naarah to buy a house in her 20s

image.altText: A Caucasian woman wearing red lipstick, winged eyeliner and a red round hat smiles in a selfie

props.synopsis: The Irish prime minister says he will intervene to help a 28-year-old flight attendant detained in Dubai under "the most appalling of circumstances".

title.children: Irish woman detained for 'attempting suicide' in UAE, Irish PM to intervene

image.altText: A star which looks like a firework.

props.synopsis: A spectacular nova may be about to light up our night sky in the constellation Corona Borealis. If it does, Australians will only have a short window to catch it.

title.children: If predictions are right, we could see an exploding star on the horizon soon
